result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton T. Belott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit of 3 days if revoked
Probation may be transferred to Marathon or Dane County

miscConds.notes:
Complete counseling as recommended
AODA and follow through

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Can be served in Marathon or Dane County
Commencing no later than 9:00 am 4-17-16.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Colton T. Belott in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15FO143 and 14FO161 & 14CF106 called at 9:14 am  Agreement 14CF106 plea to charge, sentence withheld, probation.  Stipulate to 6 month jail.  Credit 2.5 days.  Discussion in regards to FO citations.  14CF106 Ct 1 - No contest plea entered.  Previous drug conviction acknowledged.  Plea questionnaire filed and reviewed.  Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Elements reviewed.  DA appearance excused, joint recommendation.  Court finds def understands charge, penalties and rights.  Plea accepted.  Factual basis.  Found guilty.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg.  Requesting probation & jail transfer to Marathon or Dane county.  Statement by def.  Court will accept plea agreement.  Sentence withheld, probation 2 yrs.  Complete counseling as recommended AODA and follow through  6 months jail  Can be served in Marathon or Dane Co. Probation & Jail.   Commencing  no later  than 9:00 a.m.  4-17-16.  Can be served later if approved by agrent.  Credit of 3 days if revoked.  Cost assessed.  Huber privileges  Post conviction rights.        14FO161 Court will grant judgment in this case $730.00 cash forfetied.  15FO143 will be adjourned (Verified with Judge Russell to include this language on judgment)   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Colton T. Belott in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 14CF106  @ 10:38 am. Preliminary Hearing already has been held. Information already filed.  Atty Laufenberg agrees. JA to schedule for Plea. Bond Continued.  14FO161 & 15FO143 called @ 10:40 am. 14FO161 was dismissed by State.  15FO143 Needs to talk to City.  Not Guilty plea entered by Atty Laufenberg.  Court accepts Not Guilty plea. After checking off the record 14FO161 was not dismissed.

Defendant Colton T. Belott in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF106 and 14FO161 @ 11:32 a.m. Def waives preliminary hrg in 14CF106. Court reviews prelim rights, accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over Def. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived, reserve all juris. objections., not guilty plea. Court accepts plea. 14FO161 to track. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Time limits for preliminary waived.  14FO161 answer to be filed and will follow.   Bond will continue  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 11:30 am.
